oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Union Prisoners Confined in Camp Sumpter, Near Andersonville, Ga
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Drawn by Henry Blatz
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Lith. & print. by E. Sachse & Co.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lithograph of Andersonville Prison. 'Union Prisoners Confined in Camp Sumpter, Near Andersonville, Ga. Lith. & print. by E. Sachse & Co., 104 S. Charles Street, Balto. [Baltimore]. Publ. by Chas. A. Schwamb ; Annapolis, Md., 1865. Drawn by Henry Blatz. 11.25 x 17” Bird’s-eye view of Andersonville Prison (Camp Sumpter, near Andersonville, Ga.). Shows the stockade, prison grounds, tents, a scaffold with six hanging bodies. The key lists: Headquarters, Rebel Camp, Hospital, Cookhouse, and Dead House. A number of captured Union soldiers from Blount, Knox and Sevier Counties who were in Andersonville Prison later perished on the Sultana.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lithographs; Civil wars; Prisons; Prisoners of war;
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: McClung Collection Prints Collection: Prints Civil War/Other
